etymologies: late Middle English castrel, perhaps from casserelle, dialect variant of Old French crecerelle, perhaps imitative of its call

definitions: a small falcon that hovers with rapidly beating wings while searching for prey on the ground.

notes.text: Genus Falco, family Falconidae: several species, in particular the common kestrel (F. tinnunculus) of Eurasia and Africa, and the American kestrel (F. sparverius)

shortDefinitions: small falcon that hovers with rapidly beating wings while searching for prey on ground
